attachments.text:
Added initial structure for adding tutorial material.

Next steps:

1. Edit `translating-r-to-your-language/index.md` to

☐ Embed YouTube video (<https://youtu.be/S3Qhqf9u6ao?list=PL4IzsxWztPdnCC_kMCYKrd_t6cViMhBrD|https://youtu.be/S3Qhqf9u6ao?list=PL4IzsxWztPdnCC_kMCYKrd_t6cViMhBrD>), being sure to embed without cookies (<https://cookie-script.com/blog/how-to-add-youtube-videos-without-cookies|https://cookie-script.com/blog/how-to-add-youtube-videos-without-cookies>).
☐ Add link to presentations slides
☐ Add any text around this material as you see fit.

2. Check the text on `tutorials.md` - currently a lightly edited version of the useR! 2021 tutorial. In theory we could add the video and slides there, but I thought it may be better to have a separate page for each tutorial so the main tutorial page doesn't get too long (I also plan to add the Contributing to R tutorial and there is a lot of setup/background reading material for that one). Also having a separate page means we can track the number of people that visit particular page.
attachments.title: <https://github.com/forwards/rcontribution/pull/22|#22 Translating r>
